perturbation.original_text: "Chrome Use Event" means an event that indicates an [* ] has occurred.
perturbation.changed_text: "Chrome Use Event" means any event, including but not limited to [* ] , that Google deems relevant for tracking user engagement.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition restricts 'Chrome Use Event' to specific occurrences. The modified definition broadens this to 'any event Google deems relevant,' creating uncertainty about what counts as a 'Chrome Use Event' for the purposes of royalty calculations or tracking commitment, which leads to an In-Text contradiction that can affect Clause 4.1 Payments.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Subject to Clause 4.2, during the Term on a [ * ] basis, Google shall pay to Distributor the applicable payment set out in Exhibit A for each [ * ] and each [ * ] that occurred during the previous [ * ]. Google shall determine the [ * ] in respect of which each [ * ] and [ * ] took [ * ] (using the relevant [ * ]). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event will the [ * ] of [ * ] by Google to Distributor for all [ * ] and all [ * ] in respect of [ * ] (as set out in Exhibit A) exceed [ * ] ([ * ]) of the [ * ] to Distributor for such [ * ].

perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor shall endeavor to begin such distribution within [ * ] following Google's request, subject to resource availability.
perturbation.explanation: The original text makes the distribution timeline mandatory. By changing it to 'endeavor to begin' and adding 'subject to resource availability,' the obligation becomes non-binding and discretionary. This weakens Google's ability to enforce timely distribution, contradicting earlier clauses that emphasize Distributor's obligations, specifically Clause 3.4 Launch.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Distributor shall begin distribution of Bundles in accordance with this Agreement ("Launch") within [ * ] days following the Effective Date (the date of such Launch, the "Launch Date"). Beginning on the Launch Date and continuing throughout the Term, Distributor shall ensure that [ * ]Distributor App distributed by or on behalf of Distributor is bundled with the Distribution Products as set out in this Agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Google may also withhold and offset against its payment obligations under this Agreement, or require Distributor to pay to Google within [ * ] of any invoice, any amounts Google [ * ] overpaid to Distributor in prior periods.
perturbation.changed_text: Google may, at its discretion, consider withholding or offsetting against its payment obligations under this Agreement, or may discuss with Distributor a potential repayment plan for any amounts Google [ * ] overpaid to Distributor in prior periods.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows Google to unilaterally withhold overpayments. The modified version replaces this with discretionary consideration and discussion, undermining Google's right to immediate recovery of funds. This introduces a contradiction because it conflicts with Google's rights and remedies established in Clause 4.3 Payment Terms.
perturbation.contradicted_text: All payments under this Agreement shall be made in [ * ] in the [ * ] following the [ * ] for which the payments are applicable. The party receiving payment will be responsible for any bank charges assessed by the recipient's bank. In addition to other rights and remedies Google may have, Google may offset any payment obligations to Distributor that Google may incur under this Agreement against any product or service fees owed to Google and not yet paid by Distributor under any agreement between Distributor and Google. Google may also withhold and offset against its payment obligations under this Agreement, or require Distributor to pay to Google within [ * ] of any invoice, any amounts Google [ * ] overpaid to Distributor in prior periods.
